category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Optimized AEM & AEI: ex situ characterization and testing in AEMFC and AEMEL
result.description: The document will report on the conductivity and stability properties obtained with the optimized AEM and AEI developped during CREATE. While the full synthesis and structural characterization of these optimized materials will probably not be divulgated in this public report for IP reasons, the conductivity and stability of these optimized AEM and AEI will. These properties will have been measured ex situ and also in situ in AEMFC and/or AEMEL.

result.title: First generation of AEM and AEI materials for AEMFC and AEMEL
result.description: First selection of AEI and AEM synthesized within CREATE and showing sufficient conductivity and stability for being used as a first generation of materials for short-term testing the catalysts in AEMFC and AEMEL. The conductivity and stability of this first generation of AEM and AEI will have been verified ex situ before being sent to WP5.

result.title: Supply of BMs with proven ex situ properties for testing in BMFC and BMEL
result.description:
The AEI ionomers developped by TECHNION, the bipolar membranes developed from such AEI combined with proton exchange membrane (FUMA, CNRS) and possibly with an interlayer of amphoteric polymers (UNITOV) will lead to a range of novel bipolar membranes (BM). These novel BMs will be characterized ex situ in identical conditions and the most promising one(s) at M27 will be supplied to WP5 for fabrication of BMFC and BMEL with the CRM-free catalysts developped in CREATE.
The demonstrator will include at least one BM for a BMEL device and one BM for a BMFC device, with conductivity and stability characterized ex situ

result.title: Publication on the implementation of CRM-free catalysts in polymer electrolyte EL and FC
result.description: The document will be a scientific manuscript ready for submission reporting on the challenge and possibilities with CRM-free catalysts for low temperature electrolyzers and fuel cells. While the document is intended as a review paper, specific examples and learnings acquired during CREATE will illustrate the review paper, highlighting where and how the state of art of the field could be moved forward during the project.

result.title: Second generation of AEM and AEI materials for improved AEMFC and AEMEL devices
result.description: second generation of AEI and AEM synthesized within CREATE and showing sufficient conductivity and stability for being used for testing the catalysts in AEMFC and AEMEL. The conductivity and stability of these AEM and AEI will have been verified ex situ before being sent to WP5. The second generation of AEM and AEI should moreover have reached the target set in MS1 (M20) : AEMs with alkaline stability at 60 °C > 400 h & AEI conductivity > 3 S m-1 at 100% RH
